column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on bc pills for over 20 years with no issues. I have taken jolessa(generic) for several years and would have some break thru spotting that wasn't a big deal but changed pharmacies this year and was given Amethia.  The first few weeks were ok but the 4th week i started full blown bleeding!  It was very heavy and clotty.  6 days later i am still bleeding that heavy with terrible cramps!  I have never bled like this nor had severe cramps before.  I was very worried there was something wrong even though i was just checked all out a month ago.  Thank you ladies for sharing your experience so i can relax and get my pharmacy to give me the real seasonique or the jolessa again!  I would not recommnd this bc.

column2: AL10, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Seasonique for a couple years before a generic came out.  The first generic I was first given Camrese.  The first packed worked great and for $10 I couldn't beat it.  Seasonique was $55 so I was thrilled with the much cheaper alternative.  Then 2nd pack of Camrese was terrible.  I had a period almost every single day for 3 months.  Terrible cramping and much heavier flow than when I was on Seasonique.  I was going to switch back to the name brand but though I would try it one more time.  The 3rd generic pack the pharmacy gave me was Amethia.  Thought it was worth a try.  Amethia, for me, has been wonderful.  My periods which normally lasts about 2 solid weeks was only a couple days and no break through bleeding or periods at the wrong time.  I've had almost no cramping with Amethia which for me is a miracle.

column2: traveldog, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Seasonique for over a year, with no problems at all. Then my pharmacy decided to stop carrying it, resulting to me getting on Amethia. I was not even on it for a MONTH before I stopped taking it and scheduled an emergancy appointment with my doctor. Upon getting on this medicine, I got a period that lasted for 2 weeks! The pain that came with it was so terrible, I thought I was having a miscarriage. I had blood clots like crazy, and they lasted so long I became weak from blood loss. I called my doctor to ask what would help my period stop, they recommended I take 2 pills a day till it stopped...which never happened. I took twice the dosage just to make it stop, and it didn't. On top of all that nonsense, my emotions are WAY off. I'm normally an emotional person, but I keep it minimal. On this pill I would feel the need to punch anyone who upset me, cry for no reason, and became unbareable. Luckily my boyfriend handled it well during the time I was on the pills. I question if this pill will even prevent pregnancy. And the fact I'm not the only one with side effects, I know it's not just my body reacting weird. It's this pill. NEVER RECOMMENDED THIS TO ANYONE. I will gladly pay the extra money for the name brand stuff. Don't even waste time with this generic.

column2: lmcroc, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the first time ever I have used birth control (43 years old) I wanted to limit my periods as I want to travel more. I have no kids. I almost passed out the other night because Im bleeding so bad. Called my doctor this morning to tell her my concerns. She is ordering me to have blood work and possibly a sonogram? After reading this blog I think I need to tell her to change to the other pills that everyone is talking about.  This has been a nightmare. I rather have my period every month than deal with severe clots and cramps.  So glad I found this site it makes me feel that I'm not crazy and alone.

column2: on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Amethia is the worst generic brand birth control. I was on seasonique for over a year unitl my insuance company switch me to the generic. column2: londoncalling4, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started birth control when I was 15 for my period. I am 21 now and still a virgin BTW. Before birth control pills, my period would last 6 months then stop for 2 days, then start again for another 4-6 months. It was extremely heavy. I would use at least 8 ultra heavy overnight pads a day. I went to the doctor & asked for Seasonale. At the time it was new & only had brand name. I took it & 2 days later I had no period. I took it for years before having to switch to generic Seasonale, called Jolessa. Jolessa is just as good too, with a little spotting. Also I've never taken the inactive pills. I have not had a period in 7 years. Then one day I needed a refill but my pharmacy didn't have any Seasonale or Jolessa, so they called my doctor, & she gave me a free sample pack of brand name Seasonique, which is exactly the same as Seasonale, except for the last 7 pills, which I have never taken on any of the 3 birth control pills. I love brand name Seasonique. Then I recently went to my doctor for a new prescription and asked for Seasonique & was given a script. When I got to the pharmacy, they only had generic Seasonique, called Amethia, so I had no choice but to get it. Amethia is made by a different company than Jolessa. I had no problems with either brand name, or generic Seasonale. But generic Seasonique (Amethia) is HORRIBLE. My face constantly feels like it is on fire, my stomach always hurts, and I am throwing up. Remember I am a virgin so this is not morning sickness or anything. I won't be able to get a refill for over a month, so for now I have to suffer with these side effects of generic Seasonique. But when I can get a refill, I will pay the extra $100 to get Seasonique, or have them call my doctor for a Seasonale prescription and get the generic Jolessa.

column2: Ashley08, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for over 6 months now. I did not have any spotting or any of the potential side effects. Seasonique gave me headaches and a major drop in sex drive. This birth control has been great for me.

column2: Anon, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Flygirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I went through three packs of Seasonique and was happy, good mood, no spotting, light period, minimal breakouts. Last time the pharmacy switched me to the generic, Amethia. I have been spotting with clots, sometimes heavily (like a period) EVERY DAY for three months, have had breakouts and light cramps. Thankfully my mood is still ok. The pharmacy said it's the same as Seasonique, but it's clearly not! I'm switching back to the name brand for next time, it's worth the extra money! column2: Amanda, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been so nauseated for the past week on this. I've taken seasonque and jolessa(generic) and I was fine on those. But this is just aweful!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Got Amethia as birth control - didn't really care what type of pill it was, this was just what my gyn recommended. Took it for 2 months, then quit. At first, it was great. I didn't really have a problem remembering to take it every day, only forgot a few times but remembered hours later. For the first 4 weeks it didn't seem bad at all - only complaint would have been some pretty annoying spotting that started around the 3rd week. It was daily, more brown and thin than a period and required a liner and sort of made sex a little awkward. That continued daily until I quit 5 weeks later, with a couple days scattered throughout in which I would randomly bleed. Bright red, thin, blood more like a cut than a period. Still got a regular period on week 4 since it doesn't really start regulating periods for up to a year. I didn't care to wait that long, though, as the side effects became more than just annoying. Breast tenderness was out of the roof, had more acne than normal, but most of all - TERRIBLE mood swings. Went from being more weepy at sensitive subjects or movies to being full-on depressed. Cried a lot - when people left from a visit, when I heard a sad song, when I was frustrated, when the weather was rainy. This coming from someone who maybe cries once a year, or at a death, NOT at a movie or good-bye. Felt it was making people uncomfortable, not to mention my embarassment. Dropped it a week after having sex (as per the directions) and within about a week I would say I was feeling pretty normal. Got my period back 30 days later, just a little heavier than normal, but no lasting effects. Overall, I hated this experience, not worth it at all (and my partner agrees - if your partner really supports you, they will, too).

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hair went from curly to straight. As soon as I stopped started to grow back curly.Slight hair loss. Mood swings, always felt like my period was going to start, more discharge. Not sure if this all a result of amethia, but all side affects began when I started.

column2: Michelle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I couldn't take it anymore and stopped taking it, will be going to my doctor for my exam soon and will ask for another brand, the Seasonique is worth the extra money!

column2: klasssiladie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am sending an update from my review on 10/24/11.  I previously posted that his drug caused me headaches, severe cramps, and continuous bleeding while taking it. I failed to add that I had immense hair loss over the 3 months I took Amethia.  I went to a dermatologist last week regarding my hair loss. Now I didn't include this in the last post because I didn't associate it with the drug at that time.  However after my Derm appointment I learned I didn't have patterned hair loss or anything else wrong.... Thankfully! The doctor asked questions about any new meds etc. At that time it dawned on me.  I contacted my prescribing doctor who seemed to agree that Amethia was not working for me. She had me stop it ASAP.  I  was given a prescription written on it BRAND NECCESSARY.  There was also a cheaper alternative of the lesser branded EXACT DUPLICATE DRUG called Camrese (which pharmacy even accepted as the NAME BRAND).  I decided I would give it a try.  So one week later I am here to tell you my headaches, cramps, bleeding etc are gone. WHAT A RELIEF!!  Hope my review helps ladies!

column2: klasssiladie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ok so I took Seasonique for a year with absolutely NO problems.  With my last refill the pharmacy informed there was a generic available. I was happy at the pricing info.  However now on my third month I have been bleeding off and on for 2 months now along with cramping.  I thought there may be something wrong, but when I found this website I now see I'm not alone in my symptoms.  Also I have had headaches that I thought were stress related, however now after reading other reviews I think it may be related to my birth control.  Also I just read today that there are two generic forms of Seasonique: Camrise and Amethia.  Amethia is an authorized generic, however Camrise comes from the same maker and is an exact duplicate of Seasonique with the same EXACT ingredients.  I will be asking the pharmacy if this option is available and if not I WILL be switching back to the name brand.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Seasonique for 9 months, and felt great. No side effects, no breakthrough bleeding. My pharmacy switched me to generic Amethia as soon as it was available. I have had horrible headaches and have been spotting the entire 2nd month of the pack-Don't know when it will stop! I normally have very light periods. (I have NEVER had breakthrough bleeding with ANY bc pill I have been on).
